intro: Navicularia syriaca subsp. euboea, commonly known as the Euboean navicularia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves that are usually less than 1 centimeter in length. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It is native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in parts of Greece and Turkey. This subspecies is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
